page.title: 01Farm Land of Kirby Misperton
page.content: An area of fertile farm land originally powered by Post Glacial - Lake Pickering - mainly heavy clays. Majority area cultivated sugar beet, swedes, brassicas, cereals. Village stands on ridge overlooking lower farmland. Grassland on higher land of ridge extending to "Carr" lands below. About 14 farms. Large fields stretching great distance for machinery efficiency. Sheep-store cattle-some milk. Almost dutch landscape. Few shelter belts of trees. On lowest 'Carr' areas soil black/peaty. The leisure centre/zoo of flamingo park is well known and very popular. There is a project drilling for natural gas near great Harston. The Costa Beck traverses block from north to south.
